RVNL share price up 9% today. Why did multibagger railway stock gain? RVNL stock price: Shares of the company opened higher at Rs 388 and surged to an intraday high of Rs 406.10 in early trade. At around 11 am, RVNL shares were still trading 7.76% higher at Rs 400.75.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan's attacker caught on CCTV exiting building through staircaseActor Saif Ali Khan was stabbed multiple times during a burglary attempt at his home in Mumbai's Bandra. He underwent surgery and is stable.

Saif Ali Khan's attacker demanded Rs 1 crore during burglary bidThe house help in a statement to police said that the intruder who broke into Saif Ali Khan's home looked threatened her and another and said he wanted Rs 1 crore.

Saif Ali Khan attacked: Unanswered questionsThe attack on Saif Ali Khan at his home in Bandra has raised several questions-- from how the intruder managed to enter the children's room to how he evaded CCTV cameras.

Saif Ali Khan stable, knife removed to stop leaking spinal fluid: Doctors Live UpdatesBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was injured after an unidentified attacker stabbed him multiple times inside his Bandra home during a robbery bid. The actor is reportedly out of danger after undergoing surgery.

Ex Infosys employee says worked there for 9 years, had only Rs 35,000 monthly salaryA former Infosys employee from Bengaluru took to Reddit to share his candid experiences of working at one of India's largest IT firms. Referring to the work environment as "unchained slavery," the anonymous writer detailed the issues he encountered, including low wages, low salary hikes, rigid working hours and more.

Woman dies by suicide after uncle threatens to leak her private photosA software engineer died by suicide in Bengaluru after being blackmailed with private videos by her aunt's husband. The accused has been arrested for abetment to suicide, police said.

Crocodiles in captivity? A Bundelkhand fetish lands ex-MLA in troubled watersMadhya Pradesh forest department rescues four crocodiles discovered in a pond during an income-tax search at the home of former BJP MLA Harvansh Singh Rathore

Saif Ali Khan stabbed: Intruder attacked caretaker, demanded Rs 1 croreBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was attacked at his Bandra home in a burglary attempt. He is currently undergoing surgery at Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital.

Strictest pollution curbs under GRAP-IV revoked as Delhi air quality improvesDelhi's air quality was recorded at 302 on Thursday, falling under the 'very poor' category, which is a slight improvement from Wednesday's AQI of 386.

Inside Saif Ali Khan's Rs 45 crore Bandra home where he was stabbedQuestions are being raised about security at the housing complex where his home is situated. Mumbai Crime Branch has said the attacker entered the building by scaling the walls of an adjacent building.

Kareena Kapoor, Sara and other celebs visit Saif Ali Khan at hospital after attackBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was attacked by an intruder at his Mumbai home on Thursday. Following the incident, his son Ibrahim Ali Khan took him to Lilavati Hospital. Throughout the day, family and friends visited the actor to show their support.

12 Naxals killed in encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma: SourcesPersonnel from DRG, Cobra 205, 206, 208, 210 and 229 battalions of three districts, Sukma, Bijapur and Dantewada carried out the operation.

Battered, Justin Trudeau won't contest next election, might quit politicsCanadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has declared that he won't be contesting Canada's general election this year, and might leave politics. Trudeau has become increasingly unpopular at home and Canada's international ties have soured under him.

Jannik Sinner survives Tristan Schoolkate scare to book third round berth Australian Open: World No.1 Jannik Sinner survived an early scare against Tristan Schoolkate and advanced to the third round of the men's singles. Sinner took two hours and 46 minutes to win the match 4-6, 6-4, 6-1, 6-3.

How China is driving up demand for India-made BrahMosIndonesia is set to ink a deal for the India-made BrahMos missile. The Philippines has already inducted the naval variant of BrahMos, and Vietnam and Malaysia are showing interest in the medium-range missile. This is how the posturing and actions of an assertive China is boosting demand for BrahMos missiles.

Govind Ranade's clashes with Tilak were a blueprint for democratic discourseMahadev Govind Ranade and Bal Gangadhar Tilak's ideological clashes reflected India's struggle for identity. Their debates—Ranade's reformist patience vs Tilak's revolutionary zeal—shaped the nation's path toward freedom and progress.

National Startup Day: How to launch a startup in India, a step-by-step guideLaunching a startup in India involves market research, business registration, funding, and marketing. On National Startup Da, learn how government schemes like Startup India simplify this process for aspiring entrepreneurs.

Directed by Magizh Thirumeni, the film is set to be a thrilling action spectacle, with music by Anirudh.

sports.headline: Watch: Collins shuts down hostile crowd with 'Hulk Hogan' celebrationAustralian Open 2025: Danielle Collins responded to the hostile crowd, blowing kisses and imitating Hulk Hogan. The 31-year-old faced boos from the crowd after beating Destanee Aiava in the second round.

Nitish Reddy meets Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu, rewarded Rs 25 lakh Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu awarded Rs 25 lakh to young all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy on Thursday for his impressive debut Test series in Australia.

Three four-day matches to be played before India's tour of England 2025: ReportThe BCCI has arranged three four-day matches for India's Test hopefuls ahead of the much-awaited five-Test series in England, starting June 20. India will begin the new cycle of World Test Championship in England.

England pacer Saqib Mahmood granted visa for white-ball tour to India: ReportEngland fast bowler Saqib Mahmood has reportedly secured his visa for the impending white-ball tour of India, which begins next week. Mahmood will now join the England squad for their trip to the subcontinent on Friday.

Watch: Fire breaks out at Gabba, halts Heat vs Hurricanes clash in BBL BBL 2024-25: Fire halted play during the clash between Brisbane Heat and Hobart Hurricanes at The Gabba in Brisbane. The match went right down to the wire where the Hurricanes beat the Heat by five wickets.

Charlie Dean has been roped in as the replacement for Molineux.

Kevin Pietersen open to India batting coach job amid new role speculationAmid speculation that the BCCI is considering hiring a batting coach, legendary England batter Kevin Pietersen expressed his interest in the role. The Gautam Gambhir-led coaching staff came under review during the BCCI's post-mortem of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy debacle.

Coffee war at Australian Open! De Minaur plays it smart after boos for SwiatekAustralian Open 2025: Iga Swiatek, in a jovial on-court interview after her second-round win, ruffled the local crowd by saying coffee in Sydney tastes better than Melbourne. The Polish superstar was booed by a section of fans after her comments.

Australian Open: Sriram Balaji into Round 2 during mixed day for India in doublesIt was a mixed day for India in men's doubles as N. Sriram Balaji and his Mexican partner Miguel Angel Reyes-Varela made it to the second round of the Australian Open with a straight sets win over Robin Hasse and Aleksandr Nedovyesov. Ritvik Bollipalli and Anirudh Chandrasekar's journey at the competition came to an end on Thursday, January 16.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
